acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: LC50: 14g/m3 (the Soviet literature (RTECS (2004)) is unknown in steam or mist. Since it is 2.8 times of the maximum (5mg/m3) of category 4 if it is mist, it was set as the outside of Category. There is no information which can be used.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Vapor pressures 1.1mmHg at 25degC is equivalent to 6875mg/m3. Since LC50: 14gm/m3 (RTECS (2004)) of the Soviet literature is over this value, it may be mist. Supposing that the temperature was raised and experiment was conducted with steam, there is potential of Category 4.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of clear data on LD50

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Although there was a report of the chemical pneumonia by aspiration in laboratory animals, we could not find the viscosity data and  it could not be classified along the technical guideline.

carcinogenicity.rationale: The information on the carcinogenic was not acquired. There is also no existing classifications.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 4 because of its flash point: 78.3degC and liquid

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: With no information on spontaneous combustibility. By UN transportation Recommendations, it is non-dangerous substances.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on toxic to rproduction

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: The information on respiratory sensitization has not been obtained.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is eye stimulate data to human (HSDB (2005)). However, since recovery period is not indicated, the result between 2A and 2B cannot be performed.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There is a report of human dermatitis. Since it was not considered to be serious, it was classified as "Category 3."

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Since case reports on the human skin sensitization (HSDB (2005)) are found , it was referred to as Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since the effects on the renal and liver is seen as a result of continuous exposure with the concentration below the guidance value of Category 1 in the animal experiment (ACGIH (2001)), it was classified to as "Category 1".

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 2 (liver, kidney, spleen),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause damage to organs (liver, kidney, spleen)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Although there is the effect to the liver, kidney, spleen in human inhalation exposure and animals inhalation test, it was the literature of Priority 2, it is classified into "Category 2." Since the respiratory irritation was also suggested, it is classified into "Category 3."
